For me, it helps to think about versioning is a _technique_ and not a
goal =
or system property to be attained.

Usually when talking about "versioning"=
 we are really trying to deal
with the issue of modifiability at the system=
 (arch) level. Fielding's
dissertation does a good job of identifying "Syst=
em Properties of Key
Interest"[1] and one section deals with Modifiability[=
2] in general.

Once I started thinking about versioning in this way, I was=
 able to
look to other techniques to improve the general modifiability of a=
n
implementation. And sometimes these other techniques (identified in
2.3.4=
) made the use of versioning superfluous.

[1] http://www.ics.uci.edu/~fiel=
ding/pubs/dissertation/net_app_arch.htm#sec_2_3
[2] http://www.ics.uci.edu/=
~fielding/pubs/dissertation/net_app_arch.htm#sec_2_3_4
